alert.note: Alert for Bedford; Cumberland; Franklin; Fulton; Huntingdon; Perry (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 12:28AM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN BEDFORD... SOUTHEASTERN HUNTINGDON...FRANKLIN...FULTON...PERRY AND CUMBERLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 145 AM EDT... At 1228 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 15 miles northwest of Linglestown to 12 miles north of Carlisle to 12 miles northwest of Chambersburg to 14 miles northwest of Hancock. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Harrisburg, Chambersburg, Carlisle, Lower Allen, Mechanicsburg, Camp Hill, New Cumberland, Enola, Shippensburg, Lemoyne, Greencastle, Breezewood, Guilford, Plainfield, St. Thomas, Schlusser, Boiling Springs, Fayetteville, Wormleysburg and Warfordsburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for south central and central Pennsylvania. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 500 AM EDT for south central Pennsylvania.
